content.p: Any metropolitan sewer district created in the manner provided in this chapter may, if the board of such district deems it advisable, use the authority and procedures granted to incorporated municipalities by to When applied to metropolitan sewer districts, terms used in to shall be construed to mean the following: “city” or “municipality” means “metropolitan sewer district” (except that in , 2)(a) and (c), and referring to city taxes the term “city” shall continue to mean “city”); “ordinance” means “resolution”; “clerk” means “secretary of the metropolitan sewer district”; and “mayor or chairman of the board of directors” means “chairman of board of the metropolitan sewer district.”
